CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 27, 1940, pg. 21, reads: "Harlem Casino Sensation - The perfect figure and the sensational 'snake-hips' dance of talented and attractive Myrtle Wilson are combining to form a sensation at Pittsburgh's Harlem Casino, Gus Greenlee's black and tan nitery. The young lady with the 'perfect brown body and oriental features' is a holdover at the spot.  Others being featured are Lois Deppe, baritone; titian-haired Lillian Young, hot-cha singer, and LeRoy Brown's orchestra, with Honeyboy Minor on the drums."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Myrtle Wilson wearing two piece dark dance costume with light colored trim, and headpiece, posed with one arm raised, and other holding skirt, in Harris Studio, in front of dark and striped background
